alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Garza; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lubbock, Lynn, northwestern Garza, northeastern Terry and Crosby Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 759 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Petersburg to 10 miles northeast of Brownfield. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Slaton, Post, Tahoka, Crosbyton, Idalou, Ralls, Lorenzo, Ransom Canyon, O`Donnell, Grassland, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Caprock, Texas Tech University, Lubbock International Airport, Southland, Slide, Downtown Lubbock, Woodrow and New Deal. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways!
